objects.name: Scattered Spider
objects.description: Scattered Spider is a cybercriminal group that targets large companies and their contracted information technology (IT) help desks. They are known for engaging in data theft for extortion and using various ransomware variants. [cite: 50, 52, 61]

objects.name: Scattered Spider Campaign
objects.description: An intrusion set representing the activities of the Scattered Spider threat actor group, focusing on social engineering, data exfiltration for extortion, and ransomware deployment against commercial facilities and other sectors. [cite: 33, 50, 61]

objects.name: DragonForce Ransomware
objects.description: Used by Scattered Spider to infiltrate networks, encrypt data (including VMware ESXi servers), and demand a ransom. [cite: 52, 94, 159, 230]

objects.name: AveMaria
objects.description: Enables remote access to a targeted organization's systems, also known as WarZone. [cite: 94]

objects.name: Raccoon Stealer
objects.description: Steals information including login credentials, browser history, and cookies. [cite: 94]

objects.name: VIDAR Stealer
objects.description: Steals information including login credentials, browser history, and cookies. [cite: 94]

objects.name: RattyRAT
objects.description: A Java-based remote access trojan used for persistent, stealth access and internal reconnaissance. [cite: 94]

objects.name: Ngrok
objects.description: A legitimate tool that enables remote access to a local web server by tunneling over the internet, repurposed by Scattered Spider for malicious activity. [cite: 84]

objects.name: Mimikatz
objects.description: A legitimate tool used to extract credentials from a system, repurposed by Scattered Spider. [cite: 84]

objects.name: AnyDesk
objects.description: Legitimate remote access software used by Scattered Spider to manage network devices and bypass security alerts. [cite: 90]

objects.pattern: [domain-name:value MATCHES '-sso\\.com$' OR domain-name:value MATCHES '-servicedesk\\.com$' OR domain-name:value MATCHES '-okta\\.com$' OR domain-name:value MATCHES '-cms\\.com$' OR domain-name:value MATCHES '-helpdesk\\.com$']
objects.description: Scattered Spider has used domains crafted to impersonate a target organization by appending terms like '-sso', '-servicedesk', '-okta', '-cms', or '-helpdesk' for phishing attempts. [cite: 113, 115, 116]
Scattered Spider has been observed exfiltrating data to MEGA[.]NZ. [cite: 99]

objects.name: Social Engineering
objects.description: Scattered Spider threat actors pose as company IT or helpdesk staff via phone calls or SMS to obtain credentials, direct employees to run remote access tools, and convince them to share MFA codes. [cite: 64, 65, 66, 130]

objects.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
objects.description: Scattered Spider threat actors encrypt data on a target network, including VMware ESXi servers, and demand a ransom for decryption. [cite: 109, 159, 230]

objects.name: Multi-Factor Authentication Request Generation
objects.description: The threat actor sends repeated MFA notification prompts to fatigue an employee into accepting the authentication request. [cite_start]This is also known as MFA fatigue or push bombing. [cite: 62, 76]

objects.name: Enable Phishing-Resistant MFA
objects.description: Implement FIDO/WebAuthn or Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)-based MFA. [cite_start]These methods are resistant to phishing, push bombing, and SIM swap attacks. [cite: 27, 266, 273, 289]

objects.name: Maintain Offline and Tested Backups
objects.description: Maintain offline backups of data that are stored separately from the source systems and test the restoration process regularly to limit the severity of a ransomware or data extortion event. [cite: 26, 277, 310]

objects.name: Implement Application Controls
objects.description: Implement application controls to manage and control the execution of software. [cite_start]Use allowlisting to prevent the installation and execution of unauthorized remote access programs and other portable software. [cite: 28, 245, 246]
